item.title: American dies in ice cave collapse during Iceland glacier tour
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: One American died and a second was injured after an ice cave popular with tourist groups collapsed Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Arrest of Telegram’s Durov inflames debate over online crime and free speech
item.dc:creator: Pranshu Verma, Joseph Menn, Niha Masih
item.description: The arrest in France of the site’s Russia-born founder highlights ongoing disputes over social media’s responsibility for spreading child sexual abuse material and other criminal content.

item.title: Dam collapse in Sudan floods villages; local media reports dozens missing
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: At least four people died after the Arbaat dam’s collapse, according to Sudan’s Health Ministry. Local media, citing government officials, said the toll is probably higher.

item.title: Who is Pavel Durov, the Russian-born Telegram founder arrested in France?
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih
item.description: Durov, who founded Telegram with his brother, has an estimated net worth of $15 billion. He was born in the Soviet Union and now lives in Dubai.

item.title: Russia strikes energy infrastructure across Ukraine, forcing power outages
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: The attack focused on the power sector comes just days after Ukraine celebrated its independence from the Soviet Union.

item.title: How Israel and Hezbollah stepped back from the brink of all-out war
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, John Hudson, Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: Analysts and officials said the potentially disastrous exchange of fire along the Israel-Lebanon border Sunday had become a face-saving moment for both sides.

item.title: She was beaten and bullied for being trans. This pageant gave her pride.
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller, Matthew Abbott
item.description: In the Pacific nation of Tonga, the growth of Christian evangelical churches is hardening attitudes toward leitis: people born as men who live “like a lady.”

item.title: Scores of detainees in Maduro’s post-election roundup are children
item.dc:creator: María Luisa Paúl
item.description: Maduro’s forces have arrested children as young as 13, rights advocates say. More than 100 remain in custody weeks after Venezuelans began protesting his suspect victory claim.

item.title: A glimpse of the new ‘Great Game’ between the U.S. and China
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The competition between the United States and China has seen geopolitical and economic flash points sprawl across continents.

item.title: Reuters safety adviser killed, journalists injured in hotel strike in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: Ryan Evans, a former British soldier providing security services to Reuters journalists, was killed when a hotel in Ukraine was hit by a missile.

item.title: Telegram founder Pavel Durov detained in France
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina, Rachel Pannett
item.description: Pavel Durov’s online messaging app Telegram has come under increasing scrutiny from governments concerned about its unmoderated messaging services.

item.title: German feds take over festival stabbing case, citing suspected terrorism
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady, Rachel Pannett
item.description: A 26-year-old Syrian man turned himself in after a deadly attack at a festival. Officials are investigating him on suspicion of being an Islamic State member.

item.title: Israel, Hezbollah exchange heaviest strikes in months, raising regional tension
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Mohamad El Chamaa, John Hudson, Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: The dramatic but contained escalation overnight Sunday stopped short of all-out war, with Hezbollah and Israel both signaling restraint.

item.title: Hezbollah ends operation after successful drone and rocket strike, leader says
item.dc:creator: Ben Brasch, Mohamad El Chamaa, Kareem Fahim

item.title: Hezbollah’s escalated attack ‘is over’ after trading airstrikes with Israel, leader says
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Rachel Pannett, Mohamad El Chamaa, Leo Sands, Annabelle Timsit, Ben Brasch
item.description: Israel said it preemptively struck Hezbollah targets to foil an attack from the group. The escalation in Israel and Lebanon comes ahead of Gaza cease-fire talks in Cairo.

item.title: Egypt’s president warns of threat to ‘stability of the entire region’
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands

item.dc:creator: Sarah Cahlan, Evan Hill, Imogen Piper, Isabelle Khurshudyan, Anastacia Galouchka

item.title: Ilya Yashin, the activist who didn’t want to leave Russian prison
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Ilya Yashin wanted to resist Putin’s regime from inside the country, but after the prisoner swap, he must learn to be part of Russia’s opposition in exile.
